shubham902: The CAB, NEVER says that illegal immigrants of ANY RELIGION will get the citizenship. What it actually says - The immigrats from, specific 3 countries ie. Pakistan, Afganistan & Bangladesh. Will get the benefit of reduction of 6yrs (11-6=5) which means now they will become citizen after 5 yrs. And muslims will get after 11yrs. This act is Not applicable for remaining 191 countries. Which means immigrants of any religion, from remaining191 countries will have to fulfill 11yrs and other conditions to become citizen of India Things you should know- 1.After CAB muslims from this 3 specific countries will also get the citizenship. 2. Why muslims of 3 specific countries are not getting benefits, bcz these benefits are for those religion which have seen exploitation over there (in 3 specific islamic countries) •And muslims of those 3 countries can also apply for citizenship. Thn they have to follow same set of rules, which are remaining 191 countries people are following to bcm citizen of India (of any religion) 3. Muslims of India have nothing to do with this Act. Cz they are already citizens of india. 4. NRC & CAB are totally different things. NRC has nothing to do with any religion. •Documents required in NRC are- Birth certificate, post office/bank/LIC document, or any acceptable document. 3. Muslims from all over the world are eligible for citizenship of India. 4. If NRC came into Act, The Muslims which are citizen* of India have to follow same procedure, which the people of other religion have to follow. 5. Assam is fighting for ILP. And ILP is for vulnerable communities which are at stage of extinction. If ILP is provided to assam than in future every state will protest for ILP. *ILP is like visa , which means you have to take ILP from government personnel to visit that place.

tanya.chakravarty: Dear Mr. Prime Minister and Mr. Home Minister, This is an open letter from a law abiding tax paying citizen echoing the voice of many. Do not test our patience. We voted for development and prosperity. Not for you to divide us. Not again. Yes partition happened and we suffered including my family. We have built everything back brick by brick despite the hurdles we faced. Not for anyone to take political advantage of it today. We are not and refuse to be a country that discriminates on religion. This is not the will of the majority. We don’t want to debate about religious identities, we don’t want to hate our neighbour. We are better than this, more evolved than this. Don’t teach us hate or selective inclusion. This is not the voice of your political opponents, this is the voice of the people of this nation. Voice of the youth on the basis of whom you market this country. Listen to us. We want the focus back on economy and development.  Roll back CAA.
